summary: An internal memorandum from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York regarding an update on the facility's camera system status, noting that 141-146 cameras are recording on a new system with 15-20 cameras needing work, and 110 cameras correctly labeled. The memo outlines procedures for reporting camera outages.

events.title: MCC NY Camera System Update
events.description: Electronic Technician provides update on camera system at MCC NY, reporting 141-146 cameras recording on new system, 15-20 cameras needing work, and 110 cameras correctly labeled.

locations: MCC NY (Metropolitan Correctional Center New York)
keyFacts: As of August 15, 2019, MCC NY had a total of 161 cameras.
141-146 cameras were recording on a new system, with 15-20 cameras needing work to become operational.
110 cameras were labeled correctly at the recorder.
The memo establishes a procedure for reporting camera outages to the AW and Warden on weekdays when Electronic Technicians or Telecommunication Specialists are present.
The document is dated August 15, 2019, which is shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody at MCC NY on August 10, 2019.
